availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Warren County, Kentucky, attorney. Kentucky native. Married to Sallie Grider. Father of Daniel Grider, Rachel Grider, and Virginia Bryant Grider. Attorney in Bowling Green, Kentucky. Served in Payne's Company of the Kentucky Mounted Volunteer Militia as a corporal during the War of 1812. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Warren County in 1827 and 1831. Member of the Senate of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Warren County from 1833 to 1837. Member of the Whig Party. Member of the House of Representatives of the United States from the Third Congressional District of Kentucky from 1843 to 1847. Attorney and farmer in Warren County in 1850. Owned nineteen enslaved persons in Warren County in 1850. Attorney in Warren County in 1860. Owned twenty enslaved persons in Warren County in 1860. Member of the United States House of Representatives from the Third Congressional District of Kentucky from 1861 to 1865.
